In the top left corner the working of the system is visually explained.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d88it","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7kfqs","text":"The system consists of a syringe pump that is connected to a multi-valve through a 2.5ml reservoir made out of a big tube. The volume of the reservoir matches the volume of the syringe pump. The buffers and the flow cell are all connected to the multi-valve.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4korp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2r37i","text":"To dispense a target buffer, the multi-valve connects the buffer to the pump and reservoir. Then the syringe pump aspirates the desired volume (red arrow and red volume). The target buffer volume now sits in the front end of the reservoir. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4i3fc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1le0u","text":"Between the multi-valve and the tissue in the flow cell, there is a dead volume that needs to be bridged. This is caused by the volume in the connecting tubes, the bubble trap and the degasser. To bridge this volume the syringe pump aspirates the same volume of Running-buffer buffer (SSC 2X in the case of smFISH), that is directly connected to the syringe pump, directly into the syringe (blue arrow and dark blue volume).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"279d5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccv0e","text":"To dispense the target buffer to the flow cell the multi-valve now connects the syringe pump with the flow cell. Then the full contents of the syringe pump, made of the volume of the target buffer and the dead volume, are dispensed so that the target travels over the dead volume and into the flow cell.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3a5v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mq2j","text":"The system can dispense arbitrary volumes by aspirating them into the reservoir and then use its own Running buffer supply to bridge the dead volume. In systems where buffers are pulled towards the flow cell this is not possible because small volumes will inevitably cause air to be sucked up through the tubes. In this pushing system, aspirated air can simply be expelled by pushing it to the waste port. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51n8d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkqld","text":"The system can work with two different flow cells; either the FCS2 from Bioptechs or the flow cell of Rebus Bio (contact Rebus to ask if it is commercially available). Towards the end of this document you will find the steps to install either one of them. The flow cells require a different way of heating. For the FCS2 temperature control a recirculating heater/cooler is required and the ROBOFISH code is compatible with the Solid State Cooling Oasis with this Python library or the Solid State Cooling ThermoCube with this Python library. The code for the Oasis unit was made for an older model but will probably work for newer models as well. For the Rebus Bio flow cell this python library is needed for the control. All these Python libraries are supported by the ROBOFISH code.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":62,"length":4},{"key":3,"offset":102,"length":9},{"key":4,"offset":427,"length":25},{"key":5,"offset":458,"length":4},{"key":6,"offset":485,"length":30},{"key":7,"offset":521,"length":4},{"key":8,"offset":675,"length":19}],"data":{}},{"key":"4d2le","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aar9a","text":"We {"blocks":[{"key":"5vcgo","text":"Waste bottle","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1cuod","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48ajf","text":"Place an IDEX A-630 cap on a 1 liter bottle and close the big hole with an IDEX A-627 filtered plug. {"blocks":[{"key":"fal2l","text":"Flow cell","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vpdi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ljga","text":"There are two options for flow cells in the ROBOFISH system. Either the Rebus Biosystems flow cell or the Bioptechs FCS2. The Rebus flow cell comes with its own temperature controller. For the FCS2, temperature is controlled by a recirculating chiller and you can either use the Solid State Oasis (now called UC 160-190) unit or the ThermoCube.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"absf0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f413l","text":"Place the flow cell on the microscope stage. Place the temperature controller somewhere that you can connect the cables to the flow cell. The cables can be mounted to the breadboard using a Thorlabs CMS010 base with a Thorlabs CMS011 tie wrap and a M6 bolt. Move the stage around and make sure there is enough free cable to allow full movement. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqfjt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36v1s","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fljou","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"77od2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"7393C4A05A5711EA931E2B5B6607462A","height":412,"id":199042,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"673ub","text":"Rebus flow cell","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"20190716_172051.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/private/6ef0c1deccf1458cb43300e6d842ebb1ce65d97123a06c553141c132b3ce5f36/bzq3ique.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gcncique.jpg","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gcnbique.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"883B3E605A5711EA931E2B5B6607462A","height":412,"id":199044,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7rv3l","text":"Rebus flow cell temperature controller.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"20190716_172106.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/private/6ef0c1deccf1458cb43300e6d842ebb1ce65d97123a06c553141c132b3ce5f36/bzq4ique.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gcneique.jpg","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gcndique.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eauj3","text":"Connect flow cell ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46j7d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hati","text":"Connect the Y-connector to the flow cell with an appropriate length of 1/16 inch OD tubing to allow full stage movement. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dickf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mc7n","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"anpbo","text":"For the FCS2 see the image in the previous step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmic0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"D23EB1405A5711EA931E2B5B6607462A","height":412,"id":199046,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"20190716_175219.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/private/6ef0c1deccf1458cb43300e6d842ebb1ce65d97123a06c553141c132b3ce5f36/bzq5ique.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gcngique.jpg","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gcnfique.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6f6ic","text":"Valves","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8i6j2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5u5er","text":"When all tubes are connected to the valves, make sure they are all pushed all the way to the back. Now, tighten the ring. Make sure it is really tight to prevent leakage. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"q7ro","text":"Tube connection instructions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"elnoi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ck9ou","text":"In the next steps you will connect the tubing of the reservoir, buffers, waste and output to the valve. To do this make sure the tubing is cut properly so that the end is flat. We recommend using a special tube cutter for this, IDEX A-327. Push it in the hole of the valve and make sure it goes all the way to the back. For the 1/16 OD inch tubing, you should feel the tube passing the green O-ring. This takes quite some force and you will know once you are passed the O-ring. If you are not sure, you did not pass it yet. When pressing the tube in, hold it with your fingers 5-10 mm from the valve and make sure you do not fold the tube when applying force.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8inue","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8gm3g","text":"When all tubes are installed, close the ring slightly more, and press all tube to make sure they are fully inserted. Repeat this process if necessary.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56u2o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bu32c","text":"Now, tighten completely. The valve ring needs to be very tight to prevent leakage, especially if a mix of tubing outer diameters is used, so don't be afraid to put a lot of force into it. Keep an eye on leakage the first time it is used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3bo31","text":"Power","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5taml","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ate55","text":"Connect the power cables of all machines to an Uninterupted Power Supply. {"blocks":[{"key":"9j73b","text":"Software installation and Operation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8t1g2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8l1t","text":"For the software installation and operation of the system please see the code and instructions on the Github page:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ara7","text":"https://github.com/linnarsson-lab/ROBOFISH","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":42}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"851125F0E30311EAAC3D0A58A9FEAC2A","url":"https://github.com/linnarsson-lab/ROBOFISH"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ao8qp","text":"FCS2 Temperature control","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4gbnq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4c8qp","text":"Connect at least the bottom heating tubes of the FCS2 to the recirculating chiller. We do not use the top temperature flow option (black ring) because it can pop out when the pressure increases inside the loop. This can happen when you increase the temperature. We have ran successful smFISH experiments using only the bottom tube for temperature control. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39oga","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1td5f","text":"To connect to the barbed tubing we used Cole-Parmer Silikon Patin (Tygon 3350, ID 3.2, WS 1.6, AD 6.4mm) tubing. The Oasis and ThermoCube units come with a variety of connection options. Please make sure you can couple the soft tubing attached to the FCS2 to the Oasis or ThermoCube unit. Our ThermoCube has a Swagelok connector that required solid tubing so we had a barbed connector for the soft tubing and connected this to solid tubing using a Quick Release fitting from Parker. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29f4s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51t54","text":"Temperature sensing of the FCS2 is done using an integrated thermistor which can be read out using a Yoctopuce Yocto-MaxiThermistor unit. On the first port of the Yocto-MaxiThermistor unit connect a supplied thermistor to measure the room temperature. Connect the second port to the middle two slots of the FCS2 using electrical wire and two pins. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"df6l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0ubk","text":"
